benchmark_details.name: VCD (Visual Commonsense Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: VCD is a large-scale dataset containing over 100,000 images and 14 million object-commonsense pairs that bridges the gap between linguistic and visual commonsense by integrating structured relations from ConceptNet with object-level annotations from Visual Genome.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a foundational resource for discovering and leveraging visual commonsense knowledge in AI systems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to space constraints, the evaluation of the significance of discovered visual commonsense is relatively simple.

data.source: Combination of Visual Genome and ConceptNet
data.annotation: Manual annotation and alignment of existing triples from Visual Genome and ConceptNet

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using automatic matching scores for seen and unseen commonsense.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment of generated commonsense with human evaluations.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against GPT-4o and other vision-language models.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations confirm the quality and relevance of commonsense triples.
